intro: Empogona discolor, commonly known as the red-flowered milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, red or pink flowers. Its milky sap, which is toxic to many animals, contains cardiac glycosides. Empogona discolor is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including forests and grasslands.
